title: 107_hr2540
content:
The Act titled "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 2001" refers to amendments and repeals in terms of Title 38, United States Code. The Act also addresses disability compensation. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 2001" increases rates for various subsections in Section 1114 of Title 38, United States Code. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 2001" increases rates for various subsections in Section 1114 of Title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may authorize administratively, consistent with the increases authorized by this, by adjusting specific dollar amounts in different subsections. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 2001" authorizes administratively the increase in disability compensation rates for eligible individuals under Public Law 85-857 who are not receiving compensation under chapter 11 of Title 38, United States Code. SEC. 3. Additional compensation for dependents is increased in various clauses. SEC. 4. Clothing allowance for certain disabled veterans is also increased. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses is increased to $935 for paragraph (1) and $202 for paragraph (2). Section 1311 of the Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Children is amended to increase the rates as follows: $234 for Additional DIC for Children, $234 for Aid and Attendance Allowance, and $112 for Housebound Rate. SEC. 6. Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Children is amended to increase rates for orphan children and disabled adult children. The amendments will take effect on December 1, 2001.
